title: BREAST PUMP AND BREAST PUMP VALVE ASSEMBLY
abstract: The present invention relates to a breast pump, in particular a breast pump and a breast pump valve assembly each for use in providing negative pressure when expressing milk. A breast pump valve assembly comprises a suction chamber for fluid connection to a negative pressure source. A fluid chamber is defined between a first one-way valve and a second one-way valve, wherein the first one-way valve is configured to allow flow of fluid into the fluid chamber and the second one-way valve is configured to allow flow of fluid out of the fluid chamber. A displacement member fluidly separates the suction chamber and the fluid chamber and is configured such that application of negative pressure to the suction chamber causes movement of the displacement member to thereby increase the volume of the fluid chamber and draw fluid into the fluid chamber through the first one-way valve.

motivations: There is a need for improved breast pumps and valve assemblies that can effectively provide negative pressure for expressing milk.
objectives: Design a breast pump and valve assembly that can efficiently provide negative pressure for milk expression.
methods: Develop a breast pump valve assembly with a suction chamber, fluid chamber, and displacement member to facilitate fluid flow and pressure application.
Utilize one-way valves to control fluid flow into and out of the fluid chamber.
results: Create a breast pump and valve assembly that can effectively express milk through the application of negative pressure.
llama_json.research_subject: Breast pump and valve assembly design for efficient milk expression

motivations: There is a need for an efficient breast pump and valve assembly that can provide negative pressure when expressing milk.
objectives: Design a breast pump and a breast pump valve assembly that can effectively provide negative pressure for milk expression.
methods: Develop a breast pump valve assembly with a suction chamber for fluid connection to a negative pressure source.
Incorporate a fluid chamber defined between a first one-way valve and a second one-way valve, where the first valve allows fluid into the chamber and the second allows fluid out.

Use a displacement member to separate the suction chamber and the fluid chamber, which moves to increase the volume of the fluid chamber and draw fluid into it when negative pressure is applied to the suction chamber.
results: The designed breast pump and valve assembly can effectively provide negative pressure for milk expression.
openai_json.research_subject: Design and development of a breast pump and breast pump valve assembly

motivations: Current breast pump designs require improvements in valve assembly efficiency and reliability for expressing milk.
There is a need for better negative pressure control mechanisms in breast pumps to enhance milk expression.
objectives: Develop an improved breast pump valve assembly that provides more effective negative pressure control during milk expression.
Design a valve system with enhanced fluid flow management using one-way valves and a displacement member.
methods: Implement a dual one-way valve system with a fluid chamber positioned between them to control fluid flow direction.
Utilize a displacement member that separates the suction chamber from the fluid chamber and responds to negative pressure changes.
Design a system where negative pressure application causes displacement member movement to increase fluid chamber volume.
results: Enhanced control of negative pressure and fluid flow during breast milk expression.
Improved efficiency and reliability of the breast pump valve assembly through the innovative displacement mechanism.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Breast pump valve assembly design for improved negative pressure control
